channel.title: Run error
channel.description:
I'm sure it has to do with the cache cause it worked when I used a different one but i'd really like to use this cache >.<
any suggestions?
[code]ERROR! THREAD NAME: main java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 35 at com.rs.io.InputStream.readBigSmart(InputStream.java:198) at com.rs.cache.loaders.ObjectDefinitions.readValues(ObjectDefinitions.j ava:474) at com.rs.cache.loaders.ObjectDefinitions.readValueLoop(ObjectDefinition s.java:582) at com.rs.cache.loaders.ObjectDefinitions.getObjectDefinitions(ObjectDef initions.java:678) at com.rs.game.Region.addMapObject(Region.java:510) at com.rs.game.World.spawnObject(World.java:1222) at com.rs.utils.NPCSpawning.spawnNPCS(NPCSpawning.java:323) at com.rs.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:111) [Launcher] Failed initing Server Channel Handler. Shutting down... Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Thanks.

item.title: Run error
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“deadlyhorror, post:3, topic:521281”]I always post these in the wrong sections >.< this is for my source, not client lol but hm. I have no clue how to even begin to fix this, oh well.[/quote]after you learn about the compiler error it isn’t too hard to fix haha…

will give you an example. I once got this issue when I was using a prayer tutorial ( god that was years ago ) … and well pretty much what it was when I added curses I didn’t add into player class the new prayer stuff but I i did in the other class.

See in reality what it happening is the server/client only knows how to count (for the prayer) 16 items instead of 30 something items when it was my issue. So whatever you have in the readvalues/object definitions that is like (blah,blah,blah,blah,blah,blah,blah,blah,etc) it doesn’t match up to what you are trying to read.

Does that make sense?

Read full topic

item.title: Run error
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

your objectdefinitions have either too many or too less in the index and thus it’s throwing that error (I think I said that right)

Read full topic
